domain.name: Manufacturing
domain.description: The Manufacturing domain encompasses the processes involved in converting raw materials into finished products through various stages, including design, fabrication, and assembly. It integrates supply chain management, production, quality control, and distribution.

processes.name: Product Design and Development
processes.description: This process involves designing new products and developing detailed specifications for production.

subprocesses.name: Conceptual Design
subprocesses.description: Creating initial concepts and designs for new products.

subprocesses.name: Market Research
subprocesses.description: Conducting research to identify market needs and trends.

subprocesses.name: Idea Generation
subprocesses.description: Generating ideas based on market research and feasibility studies.

subprocesses.name: Detailed Design
subprocesses.description: Developing detailed designs and specifications for production.

subprocesses.name: CAD Modeling
subprocesses.description: Creating detailed 3D models using CAD software.

subprocesses.name: Prototyping
subprocesses.description: Building prototypes to test and refine designs.

subprocesses.name: Testing and Validation
subprocesses.description: Testing designs to ensure they meet specifications and performance criteria.

subprocesses.name: Functional Testing
subprocesses.description: Testing the product to ensure it functions as intended.

subprocesses.name: Compliance Testing
subprocesses.description: Ensuring the product complies with relevant standards and regulations.

processes.name: Procurement and Supply Chain Management
processes.description: Managing the acquisition of raw materials and components necessary for production.

subprocesses.name: Supplier Selection
subprocesses.description: Identifying and selecting suppliers for raw materials and components.

subprocesses.name: Supplier Evaluation
subprocesses.description: Assessing suppliers based on quality, cost, and reliability.

subprocesses.name: Contract Negotiation
subprocesses.description: Negotiating terms and agreements with selected suppliers.

subprocesses.name: Inventory Management
subprocesses.description: Managing inventory levels to ensure availability of materials.

subprocesses.name: Stock Monitoring
subprocesses.description: Keeping track of inventory levels and movements.

subprocesses.name: Reorder Management
subprocesses.description: Determining when to reorder materials and components.

processes.name: Production and Operations
processes.description: The core process of converting raw materials into finished products.

subprocesses.name: Production Planning
subprocesses.description: Planning the production schedules and resource allocation.

subprocesses.name: Capacity Planning
subprocesses.description: Determining the production capacity needed to meet demand.

subprocesses.name: Scheduling
subprocesses.description: Scheduling production runs and shifts.

subprocesses.name: Manufacturing
subprocesses.description: Executing the production processes to manufacture products.

subprocesses.name: Assembly
subprocesses.description: Assembling components into finished products.

subprocesses.name: Quality Assurance
subprocesses.description: Ensuring products meet quality standards.

processes.name: Quality Management
processes.description: Processes to ensure the quality and reliability of manufactured products.

subprocesses.name: Quality Control
subprocesses.description: Inspecting products to ensure they meet quality standards.

subprocesses.name: Inspection
subprocesses.description: Inspecting products during and after production.

subprocesses.name: Defect Analysis
subprocesses.description: Identifying and analyzing defects to prevent future occurrences.

subprocesses.name: Continuous Improvement
subprocesses.description: Implementing processes to continually improve product quality.

subprocesses.name: Process Optimization
subprocesses.description: Improving manufacturing processes for efficiency and quality.

subprocesses.name: Feedback Loop
subprocesses.description: Gathering feedback to drive improvements.

processes.name: Distribution and Logistics
processes.description: Managing the distribution of finished products to customers.

subprocesses.name: Order Fulfillment
subprocesses.description: Processing and fulfilling customer orders.

subprocesses.name: Order Processing
subprocesses.description: Processing customer orders and preparing for shipment.

subprocesses.name: Shipping
subprocesses.description: Handling the logistics of shipping products to customers.

subprocesses.name: Inventory Distribution
subprocesses.description: Managing the distribution of inventory across distribution centers.

subprocesses.name: Warehouse Management
subprocesses.description: Managing warehouses to optimize storage and retrieval.

subprocesses.name: Transportation Management
subprocesses.description: Coordinating transportation to ensure timely delivery.

dependencies.description: Conceptual designs often require specific materials which influence supplier selection.
Efficient inventory management is crucial for effective production planning.
The manufacturing process must feed into quality control to ensure standards are met.
Continuous improvement feedback can affect future production planning.
Order fulfillment processes require accurate inventory levels to ensure availability.
